The conversation among the residents of a house revolves around the monthly trash report, with John expressing concern about the amount of trash taken out, Emma suggesting implementing a recycling program, and Kate and Emma agreeing to reduce their own waste and encourage others to do the same, with ideas including using reusable containers, avoiding single-use plastics, and composting food waste.
conversation: Landlord

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly trash report. John took out 20 units of trash. Kate took out 20 units of trash. Jack took out 20 units of trash. Emma took out 20 units of trash. Luke took out 20 units of trash.
John

Wow, that's quite a lot of trash taken out this month. I'm glad we're all doing our part to keep the house clean. But I have to say, I'm a little concerned about the amount of trash we're accumulating. Maybe we should think about reducing our waste even further next month.
Emma

I completely agree, John. It's important we all do our part to reduce waste and keep the house clean. I've been trying to reduce my own waste by using reusable bags and containers whenever possible. Maybe we can also consider implementing a recycling program in the house?
Kate

I completely agree with both of you. Reducing waste and implementing a recycling program are great ideas. I've been trying to reduce my own waste by avoiding single-use plastics and using reusable containers whenever possible. Maybe we can also encourage the rest of the house to do the same? And maybe we can also look into composting our food waste? It's a great way to reduce waste and create nutrient-rich soil for our garden.
